message.content:
cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.DC, cs.ET, cs.SE. 

The paper presents a methodology for leveraging Receding Horizon Control (also known as Model Predictive Control) strategies for distributed battery storage in a planning problem. This involves optimization and control of a power system, which falls under the category of control systems (cs.SY). The paper also discusses the use of heuristic strategies and the value of forecast information, which are relevant to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and decision making (cs.DC). The optimization problem involves placement and sizing of battery storage, which is related to energy and power systems (cs.ET). Finally, the paper discusses the use of a Benders decomposition technique, which is a mathematical optimization method and falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE).
